class_b_02_math_01: Hello, everyone. Let’s have a fun class today.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_02: Tell me, do you all enjoy shopping?[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_03:
Buying tasty bread or choosing new clothes—
even just window shopping is so much fun![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_04:
In today’s class, I’d like to use shopping—one of
my own favorite hobbies, mind you—to teach\r
you all about math![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_05:
I’m sure everyone here has visited a Poké Mart at
least once. They sell all sorts of Pokémon items![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_06:
Poké Balls are one of the many useful items you
can find there. They cost 200 each.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_07:
Now then, I’d like you all to do some thinking
with me here![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_08:
One Poké Ball is 200. If you had 2,000 and
bought as many Poké Balls as you could afford,\r
how many would you receive?[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_answer_01:
[VAR BD06(0000)]Oh, my. That guess falls a little short,
[VAR TRNAME(0000)]![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_answer_02:
[VAR BD06(0000)]Oh dear. I’m sorry, [VAR TRNAME(0000)].
I suppose\r
this\r
was\r
a bit\r
of a\r

class_b_02_math_09:
With 2,000, you can afford to purchase a
maximum of 10 Poké Balls...[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_10:
However! If you purchase 10 or more of any one
type of Poké Ball...[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_11:
You will also receive one Premier Ball—a special
white ball—as a bonus![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_12: So the correct answer is, in fact, 11![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_13:
It sure is nice to get a little bonus like that on a
shopping trip, isn’t it?[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_14:
Oh, my. Is that the bell? I suppose that’s all for
now. What a shame...[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_02_math_15:
I’m looking forward to seeing you all in the next
class. I hope you’re looking forward to it, too![VAR 0114(0025)]
